name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Battery Park

reviews.text: Stayed for one night in March on business. Had a room with a view out over the water on the top floor, so it was quiet--also no hall noise, which is very good. Room itself is on the smallish size (not unusual for this chain), bathroom had just one sink, but separate tub and shower. Wall paper was a little old--overall decor was O.K. but not exceptional. Service was great, although I didn't use much of it. Restaurant closes reasonably early, although they do have 24 hour room service.
reviews.title: Quiet Location, All Right Rooms

reviews.text: This hotel was bad with a capital "B"! The rooms were not clean, the staff was rude, and the concierge was mean, and it was noisy. The only good thing was that we could see the Statue of Liberty from our room. The concierge told us there was a good restaurant across the street. Turns out, the restaurant was noisy, smelly, hot, crowded, expensive and we had to wait an hour fir our food which turned out to be gross. Don't go there!
reviews.title: Horrible Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton for 4 nights. Our room was overlooking the Statue of Liberty, and we had the exclusive invitiation to the Executive Lounge on the 11th floor. What an experience!! This was our 4th stay in New York and the area was new to us (usually staying in Manhattan). The location was fine, very near Wall Street and the metro one block away. The service we received was the very best, very warm and welcoming.
reviews.title: The best hotel we have ever been in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A little too far downtown for some- we love the location because you are a short subway ride from midtown, a short walk from Wall Street and downtown. The views are fantastic and the food has always been excellent. We have stayed several times and the experience is always the same- great. I really like the art deco decor of the lower floors/common rooms.
reviews.title: Always a great experience at the Battery Park RC

reviews.text: "Rise" lounge/bar on the top floor can get a little hectic with people for the evening view of the skyline/statue of liberty/lights on the horizon, but is worth the trip anyway.
reviews.title: Lovely views of Lady Liberty

reviews.text: Spent Easter weekend at this Property with a large family group including 5 young children. We all enjoyed the location of the Hotel and found it easy to get around, using cabs and the Subway. We opted for an older-style suite (the Hotel is refurbishing the rooms from the lower floors up) on the 12th floor with magnificent views of the Harbor and city. Some family members stayed in the just-refurbished rooms which are quite modern in style. Marble bathrooms throughout seemed unchanged and are spacious and luxurious.
reviews.title: Good Value, liked the Battery Park Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is very comfortable and the staff friendly to our children, which we appreciated. I didn't give the highest rating because I thought the Staff, though always willing to assist when sought out, did not offer the very personalized service that I consider a hallmark of a true luxury property. The Guest Reception Team did resolve a room issue at check-in with pleasant efficiency. We chose a Club Suite and the Hotel was in the process of renovating its Club Lounge. The interim Lounge is adequate but I did not see a Club Concierge present, as I have noted at other Ritz Carlton properties. There was no information provided to us regarding the times of the food presentations in the Lounge, which was initially inconvenient. We were not located on the same floor as the Club Lounge, which was fine since we probably received a better view from our room. Offerings in the Lounge were average. I thought the Club Lounge at the property in Washington DC was far superior.
reviews.title: great hotel in NY

reviews.text: We had an excellent dinner at the 2 West Restaurant.
reviews.title: Wonderful trip in a wonderful city!

reviews.text: Room service was prompt but the food quality just satisfactory.
reviews.title: Good hotel experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to say that I found Housekeeping excellent in this Hotel. Our Suite was always well cleaned and serviced at the most convenient hours.
reviews.title: Nice Property in the middle of nowhere...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I absolutely love the Ritz-Carlton in Battery Park(New York City). Located near the Statute of Liberty and Battery Park, this out of the way 5 star hotel is the perfect place to stay when visiting New York. The rooms and common areas are typical high-end and exactly what you would expect at a Ritz. The food is excellent and the service top notch. The subway is located only a short walk away. Plus there are always available limos and taxi cabs right outside. This is our go to property when we stay in New York because it is located away from all the lights, noise and heavy crowds found near Times Square. The prices at this Ritz are generally very good considering the 5 star rating. I highly recommend this property.
reviews.title: Best kept secret in luxury hotels in New York

reviews.text: We went to New York on a whim to get away and spend some time with a family member who lives in New York. The Ritz Carlton met our expectatations. I cannot say that it exceeded our expectations because I would expect no less based on the room rates. The staff paid attenton to every detail. While the property was posh which is consistent with the Ritz Chain, it was non the less cozy and inviting. I felt like I was at home or what I would like for it to be at home.
reviews.title: Quiet Time on New Years Eve with Family

reviews.text: The hotel was not "stuffy". It was very chlld friendly. We had access to the club lounge. This is the best spread that I have had at a club lounge. The service was great and there was open bar which included a good quality champagne. The beds; linens, etc were extremely comfortable. Everyone was friendly and knowledgeable including the cleaning staff.
reviews.title: Outstanding Property

reviews.text: We were right across the street from Battery Park. We caught the Ferry and were able to get a glimpse of all the attractions in the area such as Lady Liberty; the Empire State Buidling; Ellis Island. We were able to walk the financial district and saw everything including the protesters. The waterfront was nice and provided for a nice everning walk.
reviews.title: Seclusion in Manhattan?

reviews.text: There were fireworks at Battery Park right across the street on New Year's everyss on in Bat
reviews.title: Nice hotel and beautiful location...but don't disagree with anything they don't like it

reviews.text: Very nice room with a view of the Statue of Liberty but service was uptight and not as welcoming as other Ritz-Carlton's. No one went out of their way or made you feel special for staying at the Ritz...and earlier this year I was at the Ritz-Carlton in Ireland, which was the exact opposite - very welcoming and personalized service. There are many other great hotels in NYC to choose from...I have no good reason to return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Good but not great...especially for a Ritz-Carlton

reviews.text: Parking was very expensive...around $60 per night but I guess that's typical for NYC. Location was nice at Battery Park but the cab ride up to the Theater District wasn't cheap.
reviews.title: Great hotel just expensive and you still have to pay for wifi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel and good location just expensive and they still charge you for wifi!!
reviews.title: Soho Christmas

reviews.text: My husband and i decided to get away from the family dramas for a couple days and booked a room at Ritz-Carlton Battery Park. We stay at the Ritz several times a year in various cities and they are the gold standard for us. This one didn't quite show us the love.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The location is wonderful. Overlooking the Stature of Liberty and Staten Island Ferry and
reviews.title: Quite Possibly the Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed In

reviews.text: I think I ought to start by saying this hotel wasn't bad- some would argue it doesn't deserve the three stars I gave it. But I try, when reviewing a hotel, to balance the star rating against what the hotel should be, by the very standards it claims to set. So a two star hotel that provides everything a two star hotel should and more could get five stars, and a five star hotel that does a good job but just doesn't give that extra comfort, appreciation and service required of a five star hotel might end up with two. This is only to make my reviews fair.
reviews.title: Quite Location, Unremarkable Hotel

reviews.text: The Ritz-Carlton Battery Park is in a good location if you wish to be close to the Lower part of Manhatten, close to Wall Street, and Battery Park is literally on the front door. There are two subway stations about five minutes walking away, which can transport you across the breadth of Mannhatten. The hotel itself tries to be a top end, luxury establishment, but it fails in many respects. When one pays in excess of $370 a night at a hotel, it is fair to excpect that the smallest details, which, in a luxury hotel ultimatly make or break the experience, to be in check. These slight details where what was missing- yes, the hotel did provide choclates at bed time, pre-printed cards for bed time, and the reception upon arriving welcomed you ''by name'' (the doorman asks you your name, then radios the front desk with it so they address you as Mr/Mrs enternamehere) but all of this just felt truly artifical. The conceriege had a good knowledge of Mannhatten, and was helpful. Internet, as in all Ritz-Carltons, was quite costly, which is quite a surprise for one of the world's uppermost hotel chains. This is something that they really should think about changing. The hotel building itself was unremarkable, heavily wooded, but nothing special. My room lacked a mirror outside of the toilet, although the toilet, with a seperate WC room, shower and bathroom was outstanding. Also, a lack of a coffe making machine in the room seemed quite dubious for a hotel of this strature.
reviews.title: Perfect (almost).

reviews.text: This hotel, again, isn't bad. It's just so unremarkable, that in the cut-throat market that is New York, there are so many other properties, that for the same high rates that the Ritz-Carlton Battery Park commands, do a better, warmer job on properties that are either truly grand or modern and exciting, all of which this Ritz-Carlton simply is not.
reviews.title: Excellent, but with one minor glitch. The view of the waterfront was breathtaking.
Just OK
reviews.text: My granddaughter and I moved from a truly horrendous hotel for an early check-in and the next 24 hours were my 12-year-old's favorite New York experience--except for Lion King of course. The room was spacious, the bathroom even more so, and the service was brilliant. Of course it is in a price range I wouldn't normally be experiencing but as an anecdote to the previous night's disappointment. I must say we were not overwhelmed by the food..it wasn't bad exactly, just seemed quite ordinary considering how great everything else was...

Excellent & extremely professional staff. Concierge got us last minute dinner reservations on a Friday night. Statue of Liberty Suite had a view that was beyond incredible. Only negative issue was not being able to check in until almost 6 p.m. because of late check outs.
reviews.title: Nice, quiet location (not to mention very safe)

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. rooms were well equipped and spacious for New York. stayed on the 11th floor on the club level so had the benefits of a morning buffet breakfast and early evening presentations which included both complementary wine and champagne or soft drinks if your tee total!. staff were both helpful and courteous at all times top marks to "max" who served at the club level and also the concierge who arranged a limo back to the airport for us. the views from the rise bar out on the balcony was great at night{if a little chilly at this time of year} although drinks were a little pricey at over $8 for a bottle of beer once tax is added.The only disappointment was the food at the ground floor Restaurant. The steak was very chewy and the chicken was very average. At over $150 for 3 meals with drinks it was poor value for money so I would suggest you eat elsewhere. On the whole I would recommend this hotel and would be happy to stay here again.Taxis are a must in the winter months though!so remember to factor this cost in. about £10. plus tip to maceys!.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel
First time in New York
reviews.text: Dermot.Jane Laurie and Steve.

Have just returned (bleary-eyed)from a four night stay in NYC. We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Battery Park and it was gorgous, a really stunning place to stay - our lovely room had wonderful views of the Statue of Liberty and some of the most lovely sunsets i've seen. Now for the down side; our concierge mis-informed us on the location of a local bar, not something i'd expect of a concierge in this hotel - with no sincere apology. Secondly we ordered breakfast to our room and it was the colder side of warm - not good, especially considering it was $85! And finally some might find the location too far from some main uptown attraictions. But those facts aside we had a great time in a truly fantastic hotel and enjoyed it thoroughly. Our room was spacious and spotless and we loved it.
reviews.title: Delectable

reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Ritz for two nights on a business trip. From the moment you check in to the moment you leave, you can feel the power of the aura created by staying here. The service is excellent, the staff obliging, and the furnishings and appointments are comfortable and elegant. You are well cared for here, and if you have the money, it's a worthwhile experience.
reviews.title: Spectacular!
A Fool And His Money ...
reviews.text: A wonderful facility. A tasteful design that is more modern than your typical Ritz. This first class facility is located at the southern tip of the City - which is a nice retreat away from the typical hustle. The service is top-notch (try Club Level), and the staff could not be more professional! Make sure to request a room that views Miss Liberty.

I stayed with my wife, cousin (17 years old) and daughter (4 years old) in July for 3 nights in a liberty view one bed suite. The room was excellent, and very comfortable. The room was very spacious and my daughter and cousin shared a large sofa bed in the living area. The bathroom was beautiful and quality toiletries. We particularly enjoyed using the telescope in the room to watch the world go buy outside.
reviews.title: High Quality Hotel - What you would expect from Ritz-carlton

reviews.text: We also had access to the club lounge wich was well worth the additional cost, as there was food available all day and free flowing soft and alcoholic drinks - service was fantastic.
reviews.title: Quiet downtown location

reviews.text: The hotels staff were very friendly and provided excellent recommendations on what to do and where to eat. I would recommend the Italian restaurant in the building next door to the hotel it is excellent.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel and staff, great location

reviews.text: My only criticism is the roof top bar is no longer open and the hotel bar is not particularly appealing, however there are plenty of other places to eat and drink within walking distance (Battery park is much more laid back than midtown defiantly better if you are on a leisure break, as getting around Manhattan is quick and easy by public transport or cab).
reviews.title: Great hotel , in less touristy noisy areas!

reviews.text: On the day of check out the staff were happy to look after our luggage and suggested we were welcome to use the spar to shower and change before our flight home which was very welcome as we had a late departure back to London. Thanks very much to all the staff we will defiantly be back next time we are in New York.
reviews.title: Great location....beautiful views a CLASS act!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were drawn in by the hotel's weekend package that included dinner and breakfast, and were pleased to find rooms available on Valentine's Day weekend.
reviews.title: A Mixed Bag

likes.disliked: — uneven restaurant experiences; room service rates

reviews.text: There's a lot to like about the property. The service, largely, was impeccable. We were upgraded, as promised to a harbor view room with a stunning view of the Statue of Liberty and a telescope to see her even better. The room was simple but nicely done and the bed, covered in Frette linens, couldn't have been more comfortable.
reviews.title: Great place to relax and escape the tourist atmosphere of Midtown

likes.disliked: — no pool, lack of flat screen TV in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ritz only disappointed on two fronts: appauling room service rates/fees (example: pot of coffee for one: $9 + $10 delivery + 18% gratuity = insanity), and a lackluster dining room experience. The dinner menu was too limited and "concepty" (choose a meat, choose a sauce, and hope for the best) and the results were mediocre. The breakfast buffet was lovely, but midway through the meal, our waiter disappeared and was never to be seen again.
reviews.title: luxury in new york

reviews.text: After spending four days in midtown Manhattan to see all the attractions, we wanted to get away from the hectic tourist fray of Central Park and relax by New York Harbor/explore lower Manhattan. If you know what to expect, this is really the ideal place to do just that: there is no better place to stay in lower Manhattan. While this hotel certainly has significant shortcomings as noted on TripAdviser, you come here for the spectacular views, which is why I would wholeheartedly stay here again. Even though I have experienced better accommodations at other Ritz Carlton’s (I have stayed at several lifetime), the unique location of this hotel made my stay worthwhile.
reviews.title: Best Downtown

likes.liked: — Fantastic, everything you'd expect from a Ritz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOM: The rooms were nicely appointed but seemed pretty non-descript in terms of décor. We had a city view room for $325 per night, which I thought was I pretty good value. Even though the hotel opened in 2002, the carpet and furnishings were starting to show slight aging. The television was not flat screen and was certainly on the small side. Having just stayed in two Hampton Inns with flat screen TV’s in North Carolina, it is certainly time for an upgrade! However, on a positive note, both the beds and the bathroom were done in typical Ritz Carlton style. The bathrooms featured a separate walk in shower, deep soaking tub, and were of course loaded with marble. As expected, the beds had Frette linens, feather duvets, ext. The quality of the room was certainly not poor, actually well above average, but the consensus is that the rooms need a renovation.
reviews.title: Wonderful Getaway

likes.liked: — Room Size, The best bathroom compared to any Ritz Hotel, Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just spent a long weekend in NYC, staying at the Ritz-Carlton on Marriott points. When we've done that at other hotels, we're sometimes given an inferior room. At the Ritz-Carlton, we were upgraded from a city view room to one with a harbor view, which included a wonderful view of the Statue of Liberty. It was just thrilling! The service was impeccable throughout our stay. We loved it!
reviews.title: Delightful stay, welcoming staff!

reviews.text: This hotel was okay. It was nice being that it was a Ritz Carlton, but really just standard no wow factor or anything that really said luxury to me about the room, restaurant or the lobby. Not sure why my friend picked this location. Battery Park is so far from everything.
reviews.title: Nothing special. Location not good for tourist stuff

reviews.text: Stayed at this property the other day on a business trip, and as always they never disappoint. Checked in after a long day and was offered a suit upgrade which was awesome. The club lounge did not have top shelf beverages which was a odd but maybe times are changing. Great stay.
reviews.title: Always the same great service

reviews.text: We spent a very relaxing 5 days at the Ritz Carlton during Thanksgiving vacation. Since we traveled with our children and 2 other families, we decided to stay on the Club Level so we would have a place to meet and socialize. The Club Lounge was terrific! The staff was very professional, efficient, and pleasant...and VERY busy! The Club Lounge, itself, is very spacious and well-designed. There were several separate areas within the space for dining, talking, reading, and watching tv. The kids were able to play board games at one end of the lounge without disturbing the other guests. There was also a computer available for guest use...very helpful when we wanted to be our own concierge! The many food presentations were both beautiful and tasty, with plenty of variety, and the beverages: teas, coffees, alcoholic and non-alcoholic were always available . The location at Battery Park was awesome with spectacular views of the Statue of Liberty, the skyline, and the Hudson River. The walkways along the river are amazing: beautiful tree-lined parks with plenty of space to walk, run, rollerblade, ride bikes, etc. There are skate parks, basketball courts, a mini soccer field, a mini golf course and lots of spaces for kids to run around. It is really an oasis in the middle of the city, yet it is only a 5 minute walk to the subway or the financial district. I would highly recommed this property if you love the hustle and bustle of the Times Square/downtown areas, but don't want to stay there. The financial district is right around the corner, as is the 9/11 memorial, and Greenwich Village is walkable. Anywhere else is a quick cab ride (or subway ride for the more adventurous).
reviews.title: A peaceful oasis, yet convenient to public transportation and the financial district.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to a late night event downtown with my wife and decided to stay in the Ritz Carlton Battery Park. For the money this is relatively difficult to beat. The views of the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island are staggering by day and night. The Battery Park area has a wonderful renovated walkway along the Hudson. You will not regret your decision to stay here. It is quiet, clean, renovated, the room service is excellent. The prices for what you get in Manhattan are amazing and I am sure short lived. As lower Manhattan continues to revitalize and the freedom tower nears completion I am sure that this hotel's rates will climb. Until then you are a short cab ride or subway from midtown, take advantage of this.
reviews.title: One of the Best in NYC for the Money

reviews.text: This is it! Almost perfect accommodations! River view rooms have telescopes!
reviews.title: If you need to stay in this area,

reviews.text: My daughter and I visited the Ritz Carlton-Battery Park City together for a girls weekend. We chose that location because we wanted to stay down town. From the moment we drove up we were treated like royalty. The doorman, happily greeted and welcomed us as I pulled up to the curb. He asked if he could valet my car and then called for a bellman to escort us into the lobby with our bags. We arrived very early but Upon check-in our room was ready. Again we were professionally and cheerfully greeted at reception.
reviews.title: Treated like queens...

reviews.text: The bell man showed us to our room and gave us some helpful directions and pointers. We chose the "LIberty room" it is located on the concierge floor with a wonderful view of the harbor and of course, Lady Liberty. Waiting for us by the window was a telescope, as so we could enjoy up close views of the Statue, and surrounding area. Our room was immaculate and the beds were fabulous.The bed linens, towels and robes were in keeping with the luxury you expect when staying at a Ritz. I pre-requested a no feather room because of allergies and this was already honored and taken care of for us. The bathroom was beautifully appointed with separate shower, tub and toilet room. The Bulgari bath condiments were a nice touch.
reviews.title: Nice Ritz not as nice as Ritz on Central Park but much cheaper

reviews.text: Being we were on a concierge floor this entitles you to morning breakfast, afternoon lunch, drinks, cocktails and evening hor dourves. The selection at each time of day was ample and well displayed. Tasty bites with cordial servers. This was very appreciated due to our tight schedule. We did order room service one night as we returned back to the hotel late. We ordered lite fare and were very pleased with the service from placing our order (room service order taker was so sweet)to receiving it. The gentleman that delivered our food was professional, so overly helpful, very friendly and kind. The food was good- chicken fingers, pizza and salads.
reviews.title: Haven in city

reviews.text: Anytime I need something ie- forgotten toothpaste, the front desk was happy to assist and deliver. We experienced the height of service throughout our stay, right up to check out. On our departure we were escorted out and our bags were loaded into the car which was already waiting curbside.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and Service"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton on the night of our wedding. It was wonderful. The rooms are spacious by New York standards. As a New York native, I've been to many other hotel rooms that cost more and are tiny and cramped. I love any opportunity to stay downtown, away from the hordes of tourists you'd certainly find in mid-town.
reviews.title: Big rooms, fabulous views

reviews.text: The view of from our room was wonderful. The windows opened so we could let air in (I hate rooms with inoperable windows), but when closed, kept all the street noise below out. The bed was fabulous - excellent linens and SO comfortable. We both slept like babies!
reviews.title: A truly wonderful hotel

reviews.text: We booked the honeymoon special. The room was beautifully arranged. The bathroom and tub are spacious and water was nice and hot. Staff was very nice, but not too in-your-face/annoying as they can be in some upscale joints. We had room service in the morning. It was fast and friendly. And quite tasty.
reviews.title: Would stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cabs were plentiful outside of the hotel. Checking out was super fast and we were able to head out fast and easily.
reviews.title: Love It all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found this to be a delightful, wonderful hotel that exceeded my expectations. On the strength of a very helpful review from OCTraveler on this website, I upgraded our booking to the 'Reconnect Package' which is an excellent way of getting a club room at the weekend.
reviews.title: Surprised this is a RC

reviews.text: This is a great hotel with views of the statue of Liberty from your room and from the bar on the top floor. The staff have a can do attitude and the concierge are also great. Have stayed here six times as visit New York quite often. Not the most modern rooms but very clean and a typical Ritz Carlton feel. I would recommend it is also cheaper than central park and better in my opinion. Visit Century 21 its great outlet D&G Versace at a fraction of price...
reviews.title: Love it still after 6 visits!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked an overnight as a weekend get-away from the suburbs. Nice quiet location at the tip of Manhattan - close enough for a cab up to Chinatown for a party. Wonderful run in the morning along the water/gardens/sailboats. Clean, quiet, sunny neighborhood. Harbor-view king room - clean, contemporary, overlooking the water, very comfortable bed, lighting, marble bathroom and Bulgari toiletries...all very comfortable, bright and airy. Would recommend a hotel directory for the room...we weren't sure if there was a bar upstairs for a drink, times of breakfast, etc. Service was friendly, but as others have mentioned, not as polished as one might expect from a Ritz Carlton. Restaurant downstairs was convenient for a 6pm appetizer (cheese plate w/chutney/honey/quince jam) + glass of wine...and for breakfast the next morning...but in need of a make over...decor felt dark/tired for a location so close to the water. But...overall, it was a wonderful stay and great get-away for us. We would definitely return.
reviews.title: Nice get-away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just come back from 3 nights at this hotel and was very very disappointed. The bar on the 14th floor is now closed!!!, the menu in the restaruant is poor, and the very expensive New York steak on the menu was full of fat. We tried room service for a burger and chips and a bottle of wine... not good and cost £100 + !!! if this had been a 3 star and we had of paid £50 - £100 a night I would have said it was ok, but its a % star and cost £750 for 3 nigts !!!
reviews.title: A 3 Star Hotel......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Battery Park area is very nice and clean, views from rooms ( we were on 9th floor ) were very nice, and the air con was great.
reviews.title: Very dissapointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton in Battery Park in (April 2009), and found that the level of service was no where close to that of other Ritz-Carltons. While the room was very nice, the TV was not a flat screen and did not work very well. They didn't always do the turn down service with the card showing the weather for the next day. We had to chase down hotel staff to get enough shampoo since there was two of us. In addition, water was very hard to come by. In fact, we had to make trips up to the Fitness Center so we had water at night - hardly something you should have to do when spending over $330/night at a hotel.
reviews.title: great location. costly though

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for my birthday August 12-14th. We have stayed at the hotel three weekends over the past month. We had better visits the previous weekends, thus we chose to stay again this time hoping for a good experience over this special weekend. We were wrong.
reviews.title: Not Impressed - Spotty Service
Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: Initially, we were excited that perhaps the concierge was planning a small surprise (ie. upgrade or complimentary dessert) as they called to confirm the reservation, know the exact time of our arrival and acknowledged the Birthday. They had a lovely bottle of champagne on ice for my husband one of the previous trips we were there.

No one was there to greet up upon arriving at the hotel and we carried in our own luggage until a bellman saw us coming into the hotel where they intercepted our luggage. We were checked in by Ann (a pleasant reception clerk) who remembered my name from previous trips. She told my husband that she would do something special for the occasion. We were given a low floor city view that looked over a pile of construction. Across the room from ours was a plate of raw salmon and a shrimp cocktail that had been partially eaten. The hallway smelled.
reviews.title: Awesome Views and Excellent Service

reviews.text: After we returned from dinner later that evening, the food was still in the hallway and a bag of garbage next to another room was sitting outside of it. We noticed the drain in our room was clogged so we decided to report it the next morning.
reviews.title: Great Hardware, Bad Software

reviews.text: After we returned to the hotel at 4pm the next day, the clog in the drain had not been fixed, no special amenity had been delivered, the garbage bag from the morning was still in front of the other guests room and our room had not been cleaned! We called down asking if the room could be cleaned and drain fixed. My husband also inquired separately and a gentleman at guest reception assured us it would be fixed with an additional special amenity.
reviews.title: Welcome to the Marriott!

reviews.text: While the staff was friendly, their youthful inexperience made this a 3-star experience, not 4. One fellow on the front desk should have been told by his manager to wear clean clothes. His jacket was visibly stained.

reviews.text: The hotel has totally lost what it means to be a 4 or 5 star hotel. The restaurant food was consistently over cooked and dried out at almost every meal and the service was sloppy, even with what seemed to be more than sufficient staff. The rooms were hot and stuffy (humid) and the club floor food during my week long stay was the same every day, no variety. It will be my last stay at this hotel. I think the real problem is the downtown location has no real competition. I tried to voice my concerns with the hotel management but only got excuses, no one really tried to make things better.

reviews.text: We were quite impressed with the level of service we received during our 2 night stay this summer. Though there was really nothing special about the room itself (fact is, it was a bit tired), we were on the club level, and enjoyed it's use and food presentations throughout the day. The club concierges were very nice and couldn't do enough for us. The front desk, housekeeping and bell staff were also wonderful. I would stay here again without hesitation, but probably try to reserve a higher category rooom/suite next time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ritz-Carlton Battery Park was a wonderful indulgent overnight get away to celebrate our 20th Wedding Anniversary. We had a Harbour view room on the 12th floor. Upon check in, we were greeted by name & wished a very Happy 20th Anniversary. It is that attention to detail that really set the tone for our enjoyable stay. Chilled Champagne and a personalized Anniversary card from the Ritz awaited us in our room. The bed was already turned down with a robe & chocolates waiting when we finally arrived about 5 PM. The room had a telescope already set to a perfect side view of the Statue of Liberty. The view of the harbour was glorious with Ellis Island, all the sailboats & ferries to watch. At night, it was equally as beautiful with the bridge lit up. You almost forget that you're in NYC with this great water view! The bathroom was gorgeous with a glass marble shower & seperate soaking tub. There was a blow dryer, scale, lighted make-up mirror & even an umbrella if needed. The Ritz thinks of everything. The bed was extremely comfortable & provided us a great night sleep after an extraordinary dinner at Chantarelle. We definitely plan on returning.
reviews.title: Ritz was a Perfect Getaway

reviews.text: This was our first stay at the Ritz Carlton. Everything and everyone was great. The service was top notch, the restaurant food was not typical hotel food, it was gourmet. Book a harbor view room and relax.

reviews.text: My review of the Hotel itself is excellent. Great Food, Great Rooms, Comfortable Beds, Great Service. If you are planning on doing Business in Lower Manhattan than the location is excellent as well. If you are coming for a Vacation I think you would prefer something in midtown or uptown. I think the best area to stay is around the park check out the Ritz Carlton Central Park. But this hotel is nice if you are going to be around lower manhattan.

reviews.text: Wow! Just returned from a fantastic weekend at the Ritz Battery park. We have stayed at many Ritz Carlton hotels and this one rates right up at the top. The service is second to none. They knew my last name before I had the opportunity to even say it to them. Not sure how they did that, but it impressed me and my wife. I was given a upgrade to a Harbor view room at check-in, what a view! The Statue of liberty in full view. The room was very spacious and modern. We had dinner at 2 West, the signature restaurant at the Ritz. The meal was very good, but the chairs were uncomfortable to sit in. The room service breakfast was great, set up at window overlooking the water and statue. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for true luxury in lower manhattan. There is construction going on around the hotel, but trust me you won't even know or care about it once inside the hotel. We can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Fantastic weekend at the Ritz!
Lovely hotel, away from it all but in the city
reviews.text: My (now) fiancee and I are New Yorkers, and spent the night after getting engaged at the Ritz Battery Park. It was truly a lovely experience. The hotel's very nice (classy public areas, beautiful huge bathroom, very comfy beds), the views are great (had a harbor view directly out to the Statue of Liberty, and the staff were extremely friendly. The Guest Recognition staff were great in helping me get the room set exactly as I wanted it for our arrival, and went above and beyond what I had requested (bottle of champagne, rose petals scattered, all without my having to ask).

reviews.title: Beyound expectations
reviews.text: The hotel is kind of isolated at the very Southern tip of Manhattan - if you're looking to be in Manhattan but away from the hustle and bustle, that's great. If you're visiting the City, and want to be _in_ the hustle and bustle, it wouldn't be so great. That being said, it was perfect for us.

reviews.title: Blizzard 2006 New York at the Ritz
reviews.text: We stayed during the transit strike, not only did the hotel send daily updates but hotel actually looked out for the taxi scams that were going on during that historic period. Had harbour view room, not only was the view of lady liberty great, but you could also watch the 1'000's of people crossing the Brooklyn Bridge. Service, accomadations, and especially the club level staff, above and beyond. Compare with Time Square locations and their is no comparison. Will stay this coming Christmas holidays.

Having been in New York for the Blizzard of 2006 was just amazing! The Ritz Carlton Battery Park was the place we were staying and the staff and hotel were oustanding, this time and every time!! I stayed at the Ritz Battery Park last summer and they were outstanding then too!! During the blizzard, even though some staff could not make it to the hotel for their shift, the staff that could, and those that had stayed to fill in the gaps did a tremendous job! The front desk staff were the best I've ever seen in the history of travelling!! Chad and Anne were a delight!! They made our stay wonderfully enjoyable from the time we checked in, to the time we left! They would always greet us by our names and have a warm smile when we would enter the hotel lobby! They were quick to offer assistance when we were stranded at the hotel and could not leave for dinner. They made sure we had seats and were waited on promptly and seated even though the hotel was packed. They also made sure our rooms were accomodating and even sent up some nice complimentaries to our room to make the stay cozier during the Valentine weekend and Blizzard!! The beds and room were a dream and the bathroom huge and beautiful!

reviews.text: Checking in: When we booked the hotel, the agent asked what time we'd be arriving. I said around 1pm, because I knew we were seeing a matinee at 2pm in mid-town. Upon arriving, we were told that our room was not ready. We expected this. The doorman happily checked our luggage. We told the front desk that we would be back around 5pm. When we arrived back at 5pm, the same guy at the front desk told us our room still was not ready. We did not expect this. We told him we needed to freshen up because we had a 7pm show in mid-town. He said that he would upgrade us from a city view to a harbor view for the inconvenience, but that our room would not be ready until 5:30pm. He escorted us to the lobby lounge and told the host there to please serve us complimentary appetizers and cocktails while we waited for 30 minutes. This was very thoughtful, however, the staff in the lobby lounge never came around to serve us. So it did us no good. 30 minutes later, the front desk guy came to retrieve us from the restaurant and escorted us to our room. We told him how the waitstaff never served us and he apologized for this. I didn't think it was acceptable since there were only 4 other tables in the lobby lounge that had guests seated.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: Our room was so spacious, I couldn't believe it. We had a living area with a view of Battery Park, a half bath, then a short hallway that led to the bedroom and the huge bathroom, complete with soaking tub and double sinks. The bathroom was equipped with Bulgari bath products and the closet contained a pair of pajamas to be used while in the room. Our corner suite had a view of Battery Park to the south in the living room and a view of the Statue of Liberty to the west in the bedroom. The room also had a telescope in the bedroom that was already aimed directly at the Statue of Liberty. There was plenty of storage space as well: the armoire in the bedroom, the closet as well as a dresser in the hallway. I loved the huge windows because they let in so much light. Though, the windows were a bit dirty.
reviews.title: Expected More from the Ritz

reviews.text: Staff: Lee at the front desk was very kind to upgrade our room and personally escort us there. He even refused a tip when I tried to give him one. The host at the lobby lounge, like I mentioned, never told his staff to serve us, so I blame him for that oversight, not Lee. The bellhop who delivered our luggage to our room was very friendly. He told us all about the hotel and surrounding area and offered to give any recommendations on restaurants or sights in the area. The next morning, we had breakfast in the lobby lounge, and our server, Wendy, was so pleasant and attentive.

Great experience!
reviews.text: We are just returned from a surprise 50th birthday NYC weekend complete with fabulous broadway shows, dinner, boat and helicopter rides. Our stay at the Ritz added to the sumptuousness of our weekend commencing as soon as we checked in to find our harbour room upgraded to a harbour suite. Just the beginning of delights. The room was spacious and impeccable and the bed heavenly with down. We spent the early evening on the terrace of The Rise where cocktails were delicious (and potent!), the food delicious and plentiful in serving, and wait-staff friendly and warm. I've read other postings stating prices were high; I think otherwise given the setting and ambience. Room service was prompt and friendly, food delivered hot and tasty. Upon returning to our room one evening we were surprised with a bottle of chilled champagne, with complimentary 50th birthday wishes from the staff of the Ritz. Oftentimes high expectations are met with disappointment ~ our stay at the Ritz exceeded expectation in every way and I am already back online to book our next stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a lovely weekend at the Ritz at Battery Park, in part to celebrate my husband's birthday and also to attend a formal function. We booked a Harbor View room on the concierge level so that we could totally enjoy both the location and the hotel amenities. From the moment we arrived we were greeted by courteous and helpful staff that couldn’t do enough to please us. We weren’t totally satisfied with the first room we were given (too close to the elevator for my preference) and the staff went out of their way to accommodate us with a room more to our liking. Many thanks to Cullen for his persistence in finding a room that suited us! We found the concierge service absolutely lovely and well worth the extra money, the food presentations were tasty and plentiful, and the staff very happy to serve you in your room as well as in the lounge area. The bed in our room was wonderful, comfortable and plush and the telescope in the room provided us a great view of the harbor, Verrazano, Miss Liberty and the surrounding city. It was a beautiful backdrop for the sunset and the lights of the city. The bathroom was large and the shower was terrific. We didn’t eat at the onsite restaurant but had a drink in the Rise Bar which offers a great view of the city and seems to be a popular gathering spot for casual drinks and a nosh. Throw in tickets to Jersey Boys and dinner at the Gramercy Tavern and the weekend was a total hit. The only comments we would make is the lack of steam/sauna/swimming pool in a relatively new hotel, we were surprised not to have these amenities at a Ritz Carlton. We’ve read other reviews that note that the décor is a bit tired, I have to agree that the rooms could use a freshing up, but overall the hotel is typical of a Ritz Carlton experience, you leave feeling as though you were well cared for and your needs met with courtesy, a smile and the signature 'My Pleasure'!

"Maybe just for one night", he admitted. We got a harborview room with a telescope. The kids were suprised to find a 12" chocolate Statue of Liberty in the room, too. The kids liked the bathroom (separate shower) and all the extra toiletries provided. They also liked the fact that they could work out alongside Dad in the fitness center. Breakfast was too expensive at the hotel so they never ate there. My husband said the customer service was outstanding when they checked in, but not so great when it came time to check-out.
reviews.title: Kids Loved This Hotel
Excellent Choice for Weekend Stay
reviews.text: We stayed here in June for our anniversary. I mentioned this to a front desk staff person when I called 3 days before arrival to request early check-in. When we got there everyone seemed to know who we were and wish us a happy anniversary. As we got into the cab to leave, the bellhop asked if we had a good time on our anniversary. The room was great, the bed was wonderful, bathroom roomy, great view, etc. The location is secluded, with a park directly across the street, where you can also walk the Esplanade along the Hudson. Wall St., 4 different subway lines, ferries are all within 5 min walk. Don't think you have to stay in mid-town. Stay here, save $ over other 5 star hotels, catch the subway to wherever, and enjoy your NYC stay. Highly Recommended.

description: Look out across the waterfront as Lady Liberty stands proudly over symbolic Ellis Island. Sweeping views command your attention at every turn. American history surrounds you as the Smithsonian Museum of the American Indian and other impressive tributes are just steps away. As the only five star hotel in lower Manhattan, The Ritz-Carlton New York, Battery Park immerses its guests in all the luxury and cultural heritage of this bustling city.
